MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Assesses the candidate's depth and breadth of technical skills, including programming languages, frameworks, databases, and tools relevant to the software engineering role.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate based on the candidate's experience with C#, .NET, SQL, SSRS, Javascript, HTML, CSS as well as experience with relational databases, ORM and SQL technologies. Assess their ability to apply these technologies to design, develop, and maintain software solutions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Demonstrates expert-level proficiency across all required technologies. Can independently design and implement complex solutions.
Possesses strong proficiency in most required technologies with the ability to learn new technologies quickly. Can contribute effectively to complex projects.
Demonstrates a working knowledge of required technologies. Needs guidance on complex tasks.
Has basic familiarity with some required technologies. Requires significant guidance and training.
Lacks fundamental knowledge of required technologies.

MainCategory.Description: Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assesses the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate based on responses to behavioral questions about challenging projects, debugging experiences, and conflict resolution with clients or stakeholders. Assess their ability to break down problems, consider multiple solutions, and make informed decisions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Exhibits exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. Can independently tackle the most complex challenges and develop innovative solutions.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Can effectively address complex problems with minimal guidance.
Demonstrates adequate analytical and problem-solving skills. Requires some guidance on complex problems.
Shows basic analytical and problem-solving skills. Needs significant guidance and support.
Lacks fundamental analytical and problem-solving skills.

MainCategory.Description: Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Expertise: Assesses the candidate's understanding of the SDLC and their ability to contribute to all phases, from requirements gathering to deployment and maintenance.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate based on the candidate's experience in defining project scope, creating technical specifications, developing test plans, and documenting design processes. Assess their familiarity with agile development methodologies and continuous integration practices.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Possesses expert-level knowledge of the SDLC and can lead development efforts across all phases.
Demonstrates strong understanding of the SDLC and can contribute effectively to all phases.
Demonstrates a working knowledge of the SDLC. Requires some guidance on specific phases.
Has basic familiarity with the SDLC. Requires significant guidance and training.
Lacks fundamental knowledge of the SDLC.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration Skills: Assesses the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, collaborate with team members, and contribute to a positive team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate based on responses to behavioral questions about teamwork, conflict resolution, and communication challenges. Assess their ability to express ideas clearly, actively listen to others, and build rapport with colleagues and clients.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Exhibits exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively lead teams and influence stakeholders.
Demonstrates strong communication and collaboration skills. Can work effectively in a team environment and communicate clearly with stakeholders.
Demonstrates adequate communication and collaboration skills. Requires some coaching on interpersonal interactions.
Shows basic communication and collaboration skills. Needs significant improvement in interpersonal skills.
Lacks fundamental communication and collaboration skills.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Testing: Assesses the candidate's ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples and evaluate the candidate's understanding of coding best practices, testing methodologies (unit, integration, A/B), and debugging techniques. Assess their ability to write code that is both functional and reliable.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Consistently writes high-quality, well-documented, and thoroughly tested code.
Writes clean and maintainable code with adequate testing practices.
Writes functional code but may lack attention to detail in terms of documentation and testing.
Struggles to write clean, maintainable, or well-tested code.

SubCategory.Description: Continuous Learning and Professional Development: Assesses the candidate's commitment to staying current with industry trends and technologies.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about the resources and strategies the candidate uses to stay informed about the latest developments in software engineering. Assess their participation in professional development activities such as conferences, online courses, and personal projects.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Actively pursues professional development opportunities and stays current with the latest industry trends.
Demonstrates a willingness to learn and grow but may not actively seek out opportunities.
Shows limited interest in professional development and struggles to keep up with industry trends.
Resistant to new technologies and concepts.

SubCategory.Description: Adaptability and Flexibility: Assesses the candidate's ability to adapt to changing priorities, work under pressure, and learn new technologies quickly.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess based on interview responses that show ability to work under tight deadlines, handle multiple projects simultaneously, and adapt quickly to new technologies and frameworks. Seek examples of dealing with ambiguous or changing requirements.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Highly adaptable and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Adapts well to change and is comfortable learning new technologies.
May struggle with change and requires a structured environment.
Highly resistant to change and inflexible.

SubCategory.Description: Public Safety/Public Health Domain Knowledge: Assesses experience relevant to the industry.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Directly evaluate experience in this domain through resume review and interview questions.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Has extensive experience in the specified domains
Has some experience in related domains
Has no experience in the specific domains
Has no experience in any relevant domains
